section.title: Install and configure for Red Hat Enterprise Linux and CentOS
section.para: This section describes how to install and configure the Telemetry service, code-named ceilometer, on the controller node.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: Before you install and configure the Telemetry service, you must configure a target to send metering data to. The recommended endpoint is Gnocchi.

step.para: Source the admin credentials to gain access to admin-only CLI commands:
To create the service credentials, complete these steps:

listitem.para: Create the ceilometer user:
listitem.screen: $ openstack user create --domain default --password-prompt ceilometer User Password: Repeat User Password: +-----------+----------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +-----------+----------------------------------+ | domain_id | e0353a670a9e496da891347c589539e9 | | enabled | True | | id | c859c96f57bd4989a8ea1a0b1d8ff7cd | | name | ceilometer | +-----------+----------------------------------+

listitem.para: Add the admin role to the ceilometer user.
listitem.screen: $ openstack role add --project service --user ceilometer admin

listitem.para: Create the ceilometer service entity:
listitem.screen: $ openstack service create --name ceilometer \ --description "Telemetry" metering +-------------+----------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +-------------+----------------------------------+ | description | Telemetry | | enabled | True | | id | 5fb7fd1bb2954fddb378d4031c28c0e4 | | name | ceilometer | | type | metering | +-------------+----------------------------------+

listitem.para: Create the gnocchi user:
listitem.screen: $ openstack user create --domain default --password-prompt gnocchi User Password: Repeat User Password: +-----------+----------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +-----------+----------------------------------+ | domain_id | e0353a670a9e496da891347c589539e9 | | enabled | True | | id | 8bacd064f6434ef2b6bbfbedb79b0318 | | name | gnocchi | +-----------+----------------------------------+

listitem.para: Create the gnocchi service entity:
listitem.screen: $ openstack service create --name gnocchi \ --description "Metric Service" metric +-------------+----------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +-------------+----------------------------------+ | description | Metric Service | | enabled | True | | id | 205978b411674e5a9990428f81d69384 | | name | gnocchi | | type | metric | +-------------+----------------------------------+

listitem.para: Add the admin role to the gnocchi user.
listitem.screen: $ openstack role add --project service --user gnocchi admin

listitem.para: Create the Metric service API endpoints:
listitem.screen:
$ openstack endpoint create --region RegionOne \ metric public http://controller:8041 +--------------+----------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +--------------+----------------------------------+ | enabled | True | | id | b808b67b848d443e9eaaa5e5d796970c | | interface | public | | region | RegionOne | | region_id | RegionOne | | service_id | 205978b411674e5a9990428f81d69384 | | service_name | gnocchi | | service_type | metric | | url | http://controller:8041 | +--------------+----------------------------------+
$ openstack endpoint create --region RegionOne \ metric internal http://controller:8041 +--------------+----------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +--------------+----------------------------------+ | enabled | True | | id | c7009b1c2ee54b71b771fa3d0ae4f948 | | interface | internal | | region | RegionOne | | region_id | RegionOne | | service_id | 205978b411674e5a9990428f81d69384 | | service_name | gnocchi | | service_type | metric | | url | http://controller:8041 | +--------------+----------------------------------+
$ openstack endpoint create --region RegionOne \ metric admin http://controller:8041 +--------------+----------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +--------------+----------------------------------+ | enabled | True | | id | b2c00566d0604551b5fe1540c699db3d | | interface | admin | | region | RegionOne | | region_id | RegionOne | | service_id | 205978b411674e5a9990428f81d69384 | | service_name | gnocchi | | service_type | metric | | url | http://controller:8041 | +--------------+----------------------------------+

step.para: Install the Gnocchi packages. Alternatively, Gnocchi can be install using pip:

note.para: Depending on your environment size, consider installing Gnocchi separately as it makes extensive use of the cpu.

step.para: Create the database for Gnocchi’s indexer:

listitem.para: Use the database access client to connect to the database server as the root user:
Create the gnocchi database:
Grant proper access to the gnocchi database:
Replace GNOCCHI_DBPASS with a suitable password.
Exit the database access client.

step.para: Edit the /etc/gnocchi/gnocchi.conf file and add Keystone options:

listitem.para: In the [api] section, configure gnocchi to use keystone:
In the [keystone_authtoken] section, configure keystone authentication:
listitem.screen: [keystone_authtoken] ... auth_type = password auth_url = http://controller:5000/v3 project_domain_name = Default user_domain_name = Default project_name = service username = gnocchi password = GNOCCHI_PASS interface = internalURL region_name = RegionOne
listitem.para: Replace GNOCCHI_PASS with the password you chose for the gnocchi user in the Identity service.
In the [indexer] section, configure database access:
Replace GNOCCHI_DBPASS with the password you chose for Gnocchi’s indexer database.
In the [storage] section, configure location to store metric data. In this case, we will store it to the local file system. See Gnocchi documenation for a list of more durable and performant drivers:

step.para: Start the Gnocchi services and configure them to start when the system boots:
step.screen: # systemctl enable openstack-gnocchi-api.service \ openstack-gnocchi-metricd.service # systemctl start openstack-gnocchi-api.service \ openstack-gnocchi-metricd.service

step.para: Edit the /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf file and complete the following actions:

listitem.para: Configure Gnocchi connection:
listitem.screen: [dispatcher_gnocchi] # filter out Gnocchi-related activity meters (Swift driver) filter_service_activity = False # default metric storage archival policy archive_policy = low

listitem.para: In the [DEFAULT] section, configure RabbitMQ message queue access:
Replace RABBIT_PASS with the password you chose for the openstack account in RabbitMQ.
In the [service_credentials] section, configure service credentials:
listitem.screen: [service_credentials] ... auth_type = password auth_url = http://controller:5000/v3 project_domain_id = default user_domain_id = default project_name = service username = ceilometer password = CEILOMETER_PASS interface = internalURL region_name = RegionOne
listitem.para: Replace CEILOMETER_PASS with the password you chose for the ceilometer user in the Identity service.

step.para: Create Ceilometer resources in Gnocchi. Gnocchi should be running by this stage:
Start the Telemetry services and configure them to start when the system boots:
step.screen: # systemctl enable openstack-ceilometer-notification.service \ openstack-ceilometer-central.service # systemctl start openstack-ceilometer-notification.service \ openstack-ceilometer-central.service
